informal_statement: What is the least positive integer $n$ such that $80325$ divides $n!$? Show that it is 17.
informal_proof: We find the prime factorization of $80325$, which is $3^3 \cdot 5^2 \cdot 7 \cdot 17$. The largest prime in the factorization is $17$, so $n$ is at least 17. Since there are three factors of $3$, two factors of $5$, and one factor of $7$ in the prime factorization of $17!$, the minimum value of $n$ is $17$.
formal_statement:
theorem mathd_numbertheory_457:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "0 < n"
    and "80325 dvd (fact n)" 
  shows "17 \<le> n"
formal_code:
(*
  Authors: Wenda Li
*)

theory mathd_numbertheory_457 
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Computational_Algebra.Computational_Algebra"
begin

theorem mathd_numbertheory_457:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "0 < n"
    and "80325 dvd (fact n)" 
  shows "17 \<le> n"
  sorry

end
